title: AISES UCSB
text: The American Indian Science and Engineering Society (AISES) at UC Santa Barbara (UCSB) is affiliated with the greater American Indian Science and Engineering Society and exists to support current UCSB Indigenous students interested in the science and engineering fields.

title: AISES UCSB
text:
Land Acknowledgment
The University of California system was founded upon the exclusions and erasures of many Indigenous peoples, including those on whose lands UC Santa Barbara occupies, the villages and unceded lands and waters of the Chumash peoples. Many of the projects and research conducted by this university are within the traditional territory of the Chumash peoples, and/or affect other Indigenous peoples. We ask you to join us in acknowledging the Chumash peoples, their Elders, both past and present, as well as their future generations. Take a moment to listen to this land acknowledgment and learn about Chumash efforts to advocate for and and restore ancestral Chumash lands, waters, and food systems.











Map of Chumash Villages from Wikipedia Commons

title: AISES UCSB
text:
We are a group of graduate students working horizontally to host professional development, social, and outreach events, oftentimes with UCSB’s SACNAS Graduate Chapter. We also form part of the American Indian & Indigenous Graduate Student Alliance.















Rae Yee  Interdisciplinary Program in Quantitative Biosciences













Alessandra Vidal Meza  Bren School of Environmental Science & Management













Victoria Diaz  Chemical Engineering













Reina Gomez  Materials







Phoebe Racine, Bren School of Environmental Science & Management
Nākoa Farrant, Bren School of Environmental Science & Management

title: AISES UCSB
text:
To stimulate and develop Indigenous student interest in science and engineering
To provide academic assistance and financial support through scholarships
To strive in promoting Indigenous participation at all levels of responsibility in science and engineering
To endeavor in the advancement of Indigenous professional scientists and engineers
To build a sense of community and pride in our heritage

title: AISES UCSB
text:
Our Work
We are a group of graduate students working horizontally to host professional development, social, and outreach events, oftentimes with UCSB’s SACNAS Graduate Chapter. We also form part of the American Indian & Indigenous GSA and the AIIC Advisory Board at UCSB.

Current Leadership












Rae Yee Interdisciplinary Program in Quantitative Biosciences













Alessandra Vidal Meza Bren School of Environmental Science & Management













Victoria Diaz Chemical Engineering













Reina Gomez Materials





Past Leadership

Phoebe Racine, Bren School of Environmental Science & Management
Nākoa Farrant, Bren School of Environmental Science & Management

title: AISES UCSB
text:
Our Purpose

To stimulate and develop Indigenous student interest in science and engineering
To provide academic assistance and financial support through scholarships
To strive in promoting Indigenous participation at all levels of responsibility in science and engineering
To endeavor in the advancement of Indigenous professional scientists and engineers
To build a sense of community and pride in our heritage
